info.description: You just moved to the province to live a simple life. You promised yourself youâ€™ll get things done in 10 days. Plant crops, make friends, mine the mountains, populate your pond, and donate to the museum to achieve your goals.
info.ruleText:
Game Summary The game is played in 10 rounds. For each round, you will roll 5 dice. Use these dice on locations to perform the locationâ€™s action. When you run out of dice, the round ends and a new round is started. If you have completed your goal(s) at the end of the game, you win and you may record your score.

Key Terms & Rules: Checkmark: Draw a check on the checkbox or space specified. Circle: Draw a circle around the space or icon specified. X: Draw a cross or X on the space or icon specified.  Gain: Circle its leftmost icon in your inventory. Lose: X its leftmost icon with a circle in your inventory. Colon: Means "Lose this" to "Gain this", eg "Carrot : Coin", means X out a circled carrot to circle a coin. Carrot: You may X out a carrot with a circle in your inventory anytime to reroll any number of rolled ðŸŽ².  SETUP  Before Day 1, Determine your goal(s) for the game. To determine your goal, follow these steps:
  1. Roll one die.
  2. Compare the rolled die's value to the Goal list.
  3. Once you have determined your goal, circle that goal's outline.
You may add more than one goal to make the game more challenging. To do so, repeat process from Step 1 as many times as your preferred difficulty. 
If playing coop, it is recommended to do a minimum of 2 goals.
After the goal(s) have been determined, click on "New Day" to start!
 
LOCATIONS
Farm (Cost 1 ðŸŽ²): Choose a column with a value equal to the value of the ðŸŽ²you used. Add a checkmark to the bottom-most square of that column. When you check off the box with a carrot or a flower, you gain it and it's considered a Harvest. A 6 ðŸŽ² result can be used as any value when choosing a column.

Town (Cost 1 ðŸŽ²): The value of the assigned ðŸŽ² is the number of actions you can take in the town. You may not perform actions outside the Town during this. When you perform an action, reduce the ðŸŽ²'s value by the action's cost. The actions are:
  • Town Square (cost: 1 die pip per checkmark): Make friends, X a circled flower to give to a villager and add a checkmark to their leftmost empty square. When you checkmark a heart, you have befriended that villager, immediately gain a heart and a gift from them. The gift is the icon upper right of the villager.
  • Shop (cost: 1 die pip per buy/sell): You may buy and sell.
  • Buy: Cross off one circled coin to gain either 1 carrot, 1 flower, or 1 stone.
  • Sell: Cross off 1 carrot, two flowers, or two stone to gain 1 coin.
Blacksmith:  (cost: 1 die pip per checkmark): You can upgrade your tools. Cross off two stone to add a checkmark to a tool. You must first checkmark the single arrow before you can checkmark the double arrow. The rightmost effect with checkmark is active for the rest of the game.  
Tools:
  • Watering Can (Related Location: Farm)
    • Level 1: You may add 1 more checkmark to the chosen column.
    • Level 2: You may add 2 more checkmarks to the chosen column.
  • Pickaxe (Related Location: Mines)
    • Level 1: You may add or subtract 1 to the value of one of the ðŸŽ² you rolled.
    • Level 2: You may add or subtract 1 to the value of two of the ðŸŽ² you rolled.
  • Fishing Rod (Related Location: Lake)
    • Level 1: Add 1 to the value of the ðŸŽ² after rerolling it.
    • Level 2: Add 2 to the value of the ðŸŽ² after rerolling it.
  • Sword (Related Location: MInes)
    • Level 1: When fighting a monster, you hit on a 4 or more.
    • Level 2: When fighting a monster, you hit on a 3 or more.
Lake (Cost 1 ðŸŽ²): The value of the assigned ðŸŽ² determines which column you can cast your fishing line (1-2, 3-4, 5-6). Choose any target without an X or checkmark in that column and reroll your assigned ðŸŽ². If you roll greater than or equal to the value in the first column of the target's row, it's a success: checkmark the target and gain it. Otherwise, circle it. However, if it's already circled, X it. See Pond rules below when you gain a Fish. (You have a maximum of 2 attempts per target, so use carrots to reroll.) Mines (Cost 2 ðŸŽ²): Reroll your 2 assigned ðŸŽ². Then, choose one die as a column and the other as a row. Then X the cell where the row and column meet. Gain all icons on the cell, unless it's a skull. 
Skull - Roll an assigned ðŸŽ². If you roll 5+, it's a hit! Circle the left-most skull in your inventory, it's defeated. Otherwise, X a skull in your inventory. Museum and Pond (no cost, score trackers only) Museum: When gaining an artifact, you checkmark its checkbox in the Museum. At the end of the game, you gain stars based on the number of artifacts with checkmarks.
Pond: When gaining a fish, you checkmark its checkbox in the Pond. At the end of the game, you gain the star's value of all fish with checkmarks.

END OF GAME:
At the end of 10 Day, check to ensure you have completed your goal(s). If you have not, you have lost the game!  If you have completed the goals, count up your score and compare it to the results list below:
  • < 39 Points: You're new to the town and still settling in. You're thinking maybe going back to city life is not a bad idea.
  • 40-70 Points: You're enjoying the simple life - away from the city. A breath of fresh air fills your lungs.
  • 80-119 Points: You've mastered the ways of living a simple life. You've done so much in 10 days, you wonder what you could achieve in a year. Maybe one day you'll be the Mayor of this town.
  • 120+ Points: You're popular amongst the villagers, your crops are high quality and your collection of fish and artifacts grows. You were born to do this - this is your calling. Leaving city life behind is the best decision of your life.
2-Player Cooperative Rules: The rules are the same except for the following:  Before you begin: Minimum Goal of 2. Get 6 ðŸŽ² instead of 5. Checkmark any one single arrow tool. Each player rolls 3 ðŸŽ² simultaneously at the start of each day. They may not share dice. The other player's dice are gray and yours are white. Any player may start each day, but one player must use all their ðŸŽ² (or pass) before another player can use theirs. See the full rules for clarifications/different variants.
info.helpText:
Solo Game:
First, set your goal for the game. To do this, drag one die from the "Available Dice" section to the "Dice Roller", then click the "Roll Dice" button. That number will be your goal for the game, click on the corresponding goal circle in the "Goals" section at the top right (click it again when the goal is completed to checkmark it). Then click on the "New Day" button, which will mark off Day 1 and automatically recall and reroll your available dice. You are now ready to start playing!   
Clicking on an applicable space will cycle through the appropriate symbols (checkmarks, X's and O's), and once you have finished your turn, clicking on the "New Day" button again will return your dice to the Available Dice section, and roll them. 

Co-op Game:  Each player will need to click on a different "click to sit" button to see their three dice, then it is the same as the solo game above, except you roll a minimum of two goals and start the game with one single arrow tool.

clickRoutine.Note: Clicking the button starts the timer.

millisecondsChangeRoutine.Note: If the button is paused, then do nothing.

elseRoutine.Note: If the timer is not paused, then get all the variables need for the timer to perform its functions.

elseRoutine: // These try to space the dice evenly across the Dice Container

loopRoutine.Note: Die is given a random number of times to land for each roll if not already set.
If the number of remaining rolls is 1 or more, keep rolling.

elseRoutine.Note: If no rolls remain, set the scale back to 1.

elseRoutine: // Extra roll to allow the animations to finish.

elseRoutine.Note: If the number of rolls done is greater than or equal to the max number of rolls of any die, we're done. Do some cleanup.

thenRoutine.Note: If no rolls remain, set the scale back to 1.
